# Iris Data 
```{r}
data(iris)
head(iris)
dim(iri)
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, col=Species)) + 
  geom_jitter(size=3)
```
# All three different species give a messy relationship
## Filter out a single one
```{r}
setosa <- iris %>% 
  filter(Species == "setosa") 
```

Plot Setosas only 
```{r}
ggplot(setosa, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width)) + 
  geom_jitter()
```
```{r}
ggplot(setosa, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width)) + 
  geom_jitter(size=3) + 
  geom_smooth(method="lm", se='FALSE')
```
Linear regression is called "Least squares". **Minimize** the sum of **squared** deviations.

# Estimate OLS model 
(= ordinary least squares)
```{r}
m <- lm(Sepal.Width ~ Sepal.Length, data=setosa) #lm = linear model 
summary(m)
```
